questions.question: Let’s invite your friends to the party. Here invite is ……………………
questions.description: A verb that takes an object is a transitive verb.

questions.question: Our team lost the match. Here lost is …………………………….
questions.description: A verb that takes an object is a transitive verb.

questions.question: Please sit down. Here sit is ……………………….
questions.description: A verb that does not have an object is an intransitive verb.

questions.question: I could not sleep well last night. Here sleep is …………………………
questions.description: A verb that does not have an object is an intransitive verb.

questions.question: The cat was hiding behind the curtain. Here was hiding is …………………………
questions.description: A verb that does not have an object is an intransitive verb.

questions.question: He hid the money under the bed. Here hid is …………………………….
questions.description: A verb that takes an object is a transitive verb.

questions.question: I rang the door bell six times. Here rang is ………………………….
questions.description: A verb that takes an object is a transitive verb.

questions.question: When the bell rang, the students rushed out of the classrooms. Here rang is …………………………….
questions.description: A verb that does not have an object is an intransitive verb.

questions.question: I can’t start the car. Here start is …………………………….
questions.description: A verb that takes an object is a transitive verb.

questions.question: The wind is moving the curtain. Here is moving is ……………………
questions.description: A verb that takes an object is a transitive verb.

questions.question: The wind was blowing fiercely. Here was blowing is ………………………….
questions.description: A verb that does not have an object is an intransitive verb.

questions.question: It rained heavily. Here rained is ………………………….
questions.description: A verb that does not have an object is an intransitive verb.
